actor_awards.notes: Best known for his iconic role as the Cowardly Lion in The Wizard of Oz (1939). He won a Tony Award for Best Actor in a Musical for Foxy (1964). His distinct voice and mannerisms were the inspiration for the cartoon character Snagglepuss.

filmography.title: The Wizard of Oz
filmography.role_description: A farmhand and his Oz counterpart, a lion seeking courage who joins Dorothy on her journey to the Emerald City.
filmography.plot: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home.

filmography.title: The Night They Raided Minsky's
filmography.role_description: A veteran burlesque comedian who mentors the younger performers. Lahr died during the filming of this movie.
filmography.plot: An Amish girl travels to New York City in the 1920s to be a dancer in a religious pageant, but ends up at Minsky's Burlesque.

filmography.title: Flying High
filmography.role_description: An oddball inventor who constructs an 'aerocopter' and gets involved in a high-flying race.
filmography.plot: A waitress creates a plan to marry a wealthy man, while an inventor enters his flying machine in a contest.

filmography.title: Ship Ahoy
filmography.role_description: A bumbling stagehand who helps a tap dancer unwittingly transport a magnetic mine for spies.
filmography.plot: A tap dancer is hired to transport a magnetic mine to Puerto Rico by enemy agents posing as US government officials.

filmography.title: Zaza
filmography.role_description: A vaudeville partner to the title character who tries to guide her career.
filmography.plot: A French music hall entertainer falls in love with a married aristocrat, leading to heartbreak and scandal.

filmography.title: Rose Marie
filmography.role_description: A mountie sidekick providing comic relief in this musical adaptation.
filmography.plot: A French-Canadian trapper protects a woman from the unwanted advances of a frontiersman.

filmography.title: Always Leave Them Laughing
filmography.role_description: A veteran comedian who is overshadowed by an ambitious younger comic played by Milton Berle.
filmography.plot: A comedian rises to fame by stealing material and stepping on the toes of those who helped him.

filmography.title: Just Around the Corner
filmography.role_description: A jovial doorman at the Riverview apartments who interacts with Shirley Temple's character.
filmography.plot: A young girl tries to help her father during the Great Depression by organizing a benefit show.

filmography.title: Meet the People
filmography.role_description: A eccentric shipyard worker and relative of the protagonist in this wartime musical.
filmography.plot: A Broadway star takes a job in a shipyard to better understand the common people for a role.

filmography.title: Sing Your Worries Away
filmography.role_description: A songwriter who gets mixed up with gangsters in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: A songwriter and his suicidal partner get involved with a plan to inherit a fortune.

filmography.title: Mr. Universe
filmography.role_description: A wrestling promoter who discovers a 'clean' wrestler and tries to make him a star.
filmography.plot: A wrestling promoter tries to turn a naive bodybuilder into a professional wrestler.

filmography.title: Josette
filmography.role_description: The owner of a New Orleans nightclub where the title character sings.
filmography.plot: Two brothers try to save their wealthy father from a gold-digging singer in New Orleans.

filmography.title: Love and Hisses
filmography.role_description: A fast-talking press agent caught in the middle of a feud between Walter Winchell and Ben Bernie.
filmography.plot: A gossip columnist and a bandleader continue their feud while a new singer tries to make it big.

filmography.title: Merry-Go-Round of 1938
filmography.role_description: A member of a comedy troupe comprising four vaudevillians trying to help a young woman.
filmography.plot: Four vaudeville comics assume the guardianship of a young girl and try to launch her show business career.

filmography.title: The Second Greatest Sex
filmography.role_description: A character in this musical comedy retelling of the Lysistrata legend set in the Old West.
filmography.plot: In the Wild West, women go on a 'love strike' to force their men to stop fighting with a rival town.

filmography.title: Ten Girls Ago
filmography.role_description: A TV clown who tries to help an unemployed actor in this Canadian musical.
filmography.plot: An unemployed actor is mistaken for a television personality.

filmography.title: Faint Heart
filmography.role_description: Lahr's film debut in a comedic short subject.
filmography.plot: A comedic short film featuring Lahr's vaudeville style humor.

filmography.title: Henry the Ache
filmography.role_description: A comedic portrayal of the English monarch in a short film.
filmography.plot: A burlesque take on the life of King Henry VIII.

filmography.title: No More West
filmography.role_description: The lead in this comedy short where he plays a city slicker out west.
filmography.plot: A comedic short about a man from the East who finds himself in the Wild West.

filmography.title: Gold Bricks
filmography.role_description: The lead character in this comedy short.
filmography.plot: A musical comedy short subject featuring Bert Lahr's signature humor.

filmography.title: Boy, Oh Boy
filmography.role_description: A comedic butler involved in a chaotic household in this short film.
filmography.plot: A butler must deal with his master's eccentricities and family problems.

filmography.title: Whose Baby Are You?
filmography.role_description: A man caught in a misunderstanding regarding a baby in this short.
filmography.plot: A comedy of errors ensues when a baby is left on a doorstep.

filmography.title: Off the Horses
filmography.role_description: A man with a gambling problem in this comedy short.
filmography.plot: A man promises his wife he will stop betting on horses, but temptation proves too strong.

filmography.title: Montague the Magnificent
filmography.role_description: An actor dealing with a hammy roommate in this short subject.
filmography.plot: A shy man deals with his roommate, a pompous actor named Montague.

filmography.title: Thompson's Ghost
filmography.role_description: A ghost who returns to his family after 400 years in this TV movie.
filmography.plot: A ghost returns to earth to help his descendants, but finds modern life confusing.
